meanings.sent1: I need some mool to buy a new toy.
meanings.sent2: He worked hard to earn enough mool for his vacation.
meanings.sent3: The birthday card was filled with mool for the lucky kid.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled when she saw the shiny mool in the treasure chest.
meanings.sent5: The magician pulled a rabbit out of his hat, along with a handful of colorful mool.

meanings.definition: To move or act in a slow, lazy manner.
meanings.sent1: The cat likes to mool around in the sun all day.
meanings.sent2: Don't mool around, we have work to do!
meanings.sent3: After a big meal, he would mool on the couch for hours.
meanings.sent4: The old car mooled along the bumpy road, barely moving.
meanings.sent5: The sloth would mool from tree to tree, never in a hurry.

meanings.sent1: The gardener planted flowers in the rich mool of the garden.
meanings.sent2: The children loved playing in the mool, making mud pies.
meanings.sent3: The farmer's boots sank into the wet mool after the rain.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins were covered in layers of dusty mool.
meanings.sent5: The artist used mool to create a textured painting of the landscape.
